Package regressionAnalysisCalc

Class AnalysisLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • regressionAnalysisCalc.AnalysisLibrary
  • public class AnalysisLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
    Analysis Library provides a set of methods to perform statistical analysis, including mean, median, measures of spread, range, and regression models. A set of methods for rounding decimals is also included. All calculations will yield unrounded values. This class is not meant to be instantiated.
    Version:
    Jan 2022
    Author:
    Katelyn Lam

        Parameters:
        unsorted - an array of type double, not in order of increasing values
        Returns:
        double[] - a sorted array with the same values as unsorted in order of increasing values

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • median

        public static double median​(double[] data,
                            boolean isSorted)
        Finds the median (the number for which half the values are above and half are below) of a set of data.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of type double
        Returns:
        double - the median, which is an element of the data set (or the average of the two middle elements if the data set has an even length)

      • range

        public static double range​(double[] data)
        Finds the range (difference between highest and lowest values) of the data set.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of type double
        Returns:
        double - the range of the set of data

      • interquartileRange

        public static double[] interquartileRange​(double[] data)
        Finds the quartiles and interquartile range of the set of data. The interquartile range (IQR) is the difference between Q1 and Q3, where Q1 is the median of the first half of the data set and Q3 is the median of the second half of the data set.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of type double
        Returns:
        double[] - an array where {Q1, Q3, IQR} is returned

      • variance

        public static double variance​(double[] data,
                              boolean isSample)
        Finds the variance of a set of data. The variance is a measure of spread of a set of data about the arithmetic mean. It is calculated by taking the summation of the square of the deviation, or difference between a data value and the arithmetic mean, then divided by the number of points, n (for a census) and n - 1 (for a sample). The sample variance has a lower denominator because the deviation tends to be lower than the actual value.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of type double
        isSample - true if data represents a sample, false if data represents a census. For this regression analysis calculator, all data is assumed to be a sample.
        Returns:
        double - the variance of the data set

      • stDev

        public static double stDev​(double[] data,
                           boolean isSample)
        Finds the standard deviation of a set of data. The standard deviation is the average deviation for a given data point from the arithmetic mean.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of type double
        isSample - true if data represents a sample, false if data represents a census. For this regression analysis calculator, all data is assumed to be a sample. Must be same state if variance() is called.
        Returns:
        double - the standard deviation of the data set

      • covariance

        public static double covariance​(double[] dataX,
                                double[] dataY)
        Finds the covariance of a set of data. The covariance represents the average spread of the independent variable x and dependent variable y.
        Parameters:
        dataX - an array of type double representing the values of the independent variable
        dataY - an array of type double representing the values of the dependent variable. Must be the same length as dataX.
        Returns:
        double - the covariance of dataX and dataY

      • rFactor

        public static double rFactor​(double[] dataX,
                             double[] dataY)
        Finds the Pearson Correlation Coefficient (PCC or r) of a linear regression. It is a quantitative measure of how well the line of best fit represents a two-variable data set.
        Parameters:
        dataX - an array of type double representing the values of the independent variable.
        dataY - an array of type double representing the values of the dependent variable. Must be the same length as dataX.
        Returns:
        double - the PCC of dataX and dataY, where 0 <= PCC <= 1

      • correlationType

        public static java.lang.String correlationType​(double rFactor)
        Determines the strength of a linear correlation given a value of the Pearson Correlation Coefficient (PCC), (or r). The linear correlation is described as follows:
        • if r= 0, there is no correlation.
        • if r = 1, there is a perfect correlation.
        • If r < 0, there is a negative (-) correlation. If r > 0, there is a positive (+) correlation.
        • If 0 < |r| <= 1/3 there is a weak correlation. If 1/3 < |r| <= 2/3 there is a moderate correlation, and a strong correlation is where 2/3 < |r| < 1.
        Parameters:
        rFactor - - the PCC of a linear relationship. This function can only be called when an rFactor exists in a linear correlation.
        Returns:
        String - the type of correlation, outputted as "Positive/Negative Weak/Moderate/Strong Correlation"

      • rSquared

        public static double rSquared​(double[] dataX,
                              double[] dataY,
                              int regressionType)
        Determines the coefficient of determination, or R2 for any regression model. R2 is a quantitative measure that shows the proportion of the actual value that can be explained by the regression mode. If a PCC or (r) exists, then R2 is the square of r. The supported regression models are: linear, quadratic, power (log-log method) and exponential (log method).
        Parameters:
        dataX - an array of type double representing the values of the independent variable
        dataY - an array of type double representing the values of the dependent variable, which must be the same length as dataX
        regressionType - the regression model used to compute R2. Must be 1 - linear, 2 - quadratic, 3 - power, 4 - exponential
        Returns:
        double - the value of R2 where 0 <= R2 < 1.

      • linearRegression

        public static double[] linearRegression​(double[] dataX,
                                        double[] dataY)
        Determines a line of best fit for the graph y vs x where y is the dependent variable and x is the independent variable. The line of best fit can be represented by the equation y = mx + b.
        Parameters:
        dataX - an array of type double representing the values of the independent variable
        dataY - an array of type double representing the values of the dependent variable
        Returns:
        double[] - an array of arguments for the line of best fit, represented as {slope(m), y-intercept(b)}

      • quadraticRegression

        public static double[] quadraticRegression​(double[] dataX,
                                           double[] dataY)
        Determines a curve of best fit for the graph y vs x where y is the dependent variable and x is the independent variable. The curve of best fit can be represented by the equation y = ax2+ bx + c. Reference this source to see how the quadratic regression is performed.
        Parameters:
        dataX - an array of type double representing the values of the independent variable
        dataY - an array of type double representing the values of the dependent variable
        Returns:
        double[] - an array of arguments for the curve of best fit, represented as {a,b,c}

      • powerRegression

        public static double[] powerRegression​(double[] dataX,
                                       double[] dataY)
        Determines a curve of best fit for the graph y vs x where y is the dependent variable and x is the independent variable. The curve of best fit can be represented by the equation y = axb. Reference this source to see how the power regression is performed. Note: this uses the log-log method which performs a linear regression on lny vs. lnx before expressing y in terms of a power function of x. This is not the most accurate power regression model.
        Parameters:
        dataX - an array of type double representing the values of the independent variable
        dataY - an array of type double representing the values of the dependent variable
        Returns:
        double[] - an array of arguments for the curve of best fit, represented as {a,b,PCC}. The PCC is for the linear regression of lny vs lnx

      • exponentialRegression

        public static double[] exponentialRegression​(double[] dataX,
                                             double[] dataY)
        Determines a curve of best fit for the graph y vs x where y is the dependent variable and x is the independent variable. The curve of best fit can be represented by the equation y = abx. Reference this source to see how the exponential regression is performed. Note: this uses the log method which performs a linear regression on lny vs. x before expressing y in terms of an exponential function of x. This is not the most accurate exponential regression model.
        Parameters:
        dataX - an array of type double representing the values of the independent variable
        dataY - an array of type double representing the values of the dependent variable
        Returns:
        double[] - an array of arguments for the curve of best fit, represented as {a,b,PCC}. The PCC is for the linear regression of lny vs x

      • computeFunction

        public static double computeFunction​(double[] args,
                                     int regIndex,
                                     boolean isY,
                                     double variable)
        Solves for a value of x or y given a function and the value of either one of those variables. Can only solve for linear, quadratic, power, and exponential equations.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments returned after a regression is performed, representing constants in the equation
        regIndex - an integer used to refer to the regression model. Ranges from 1 - 4 where 1: Linear, 2: Quadratic, 3: Power, 4: Exponential
        isY - state of if the equation is solving for y. true if solving for y and false if solving for x
        variable - value of the given variable (x if solving for y, y if solving for x)
        Returns:
        double the solved value

      • roundDecimal

        public static java.lang.String roundDecimal​(double num,
                                            int places)
        Rounds a decimal number to a preferred number of places and returns it as a String. The function rounds down for a number that is less than 5, and rounds up for a number greater or equal to 5.
        Parameters:
        num - unrounded decimal value
        places - the number of decimal places a value is rounded to, which must be greater or equal to 0. If the number is smaller than the places (for.ex rounding 0.0000412 to 2 decimal places, the number is rounded to 1 significant digit (so 0.0000412 would be rounded to 0.00004).
        Returns:
        String - the rounded decimal

      • maxNumDecimalPlaces

        public static int maxNumDecimalPlaces​(double[] data)
        Determines the greatest number of decimal places of a number in a set of data.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of type double
        Returns:
        int - the maximum number of decimal places of any number in the data set
